history.content:
When I worked in industry last summer I used CLion extensively for C++, and it's worked really well. If you've used the PyChar and IntelliJ IDEs already, I would highly recommend it. You also get a free license for having a .edu email.

Last semester I also did all of the 184 projects with O'Brien in CLion.

When I worked in industry last summer I used CLion extensively for C++, and it's worked really well. If you've used the PyChar and IntelliJ IDEs already, I would highly recommend it. You also get a free license for having a .edu email.

children.subject: Oh shoot really?? I've been using the free version of pycharm this entire time :( Thanks so much for the heads up.

history.content:
I've never worked in C++ and I used Sublime and terminal for make-ing in 162, 61c. That being said, what are your favorite IDE's for C++?

I'm leaning towards using xcode or CLion (only because I like IntelliJ and Pycharm).
